definitions.definition: (of clothes or fabric) having a pattern of small squares.
(of a vowel) followed by one or more consonants in the same syllable.
examine (something) in order to determine its accuracy, quality, or condition, or to detect the presence of something.
examples: customs officers have the right to check all luggage
synonyms: give something a once-over "troops checked all vehicles"

definitions.definition: verify or establish to one's satisfaction.
examples: check the expiration date on your passport
synonyms: verify "he checked that the gun was cocked"

definitions.definition: verify the accuracy of something by comparing it with (something else).
examples: keep your receipt to check against your statement

definitions.definition: stop or slow down the progress of (something undesirable).
examples: efforts were made to check the disease
synonyms: slow down; literarystay "two defeats checked their progress"

definitions.definition: curb or restrain (a feeling or emotion).
examples: he learned to check his excitement
synonyms: choke back; informalkeep a lid on "her tears could not be checked"

definitions.definition: hamper or neutralize (an opponent) with one's body or stick.

examples: processes to check against deterioration in the quality of the data held

definitions.definition: (of a passenger) consign (baggage) to the care of the transport provider with whom they are traveling.
examples: I checked my bag and got my boarding pass

definitions.definition: deposit (a coat, bag, or other item) for temporary safekeeping in the cloakroom of a restaurant, theater, etc.
examples: the drinks weren't expensive and there's no cover charge but you do have to check your coat for $3.00

definitions.definition: mark or click on (a box) in order to select a particular option on a form, questionnaire, etc.
examples: users who want privacy should check the box that prevents your files from being shared

definitions.definition: move a piece or pawn so that (the opposing king) is under attack.
(in poker) choose not to make a bet when called upon, allowing the action to move to another player.
(of a hound) pause to make sure of or regain a scent.
(of a trained hawk) abandon the intended quarry and fly after other prey.
